subject: Re: [junit] @Before vs constructor
msgSnippet: ... The set of documented guarantees got much tighter in JUnit 4.5:
messageBody:
On Thu, Oct 23, 2008 at 10:46 AM, Ilja Preu√ü <iljapreuss@...> wrote:
> 2008/10/22 Ahmed S Ashour <asashour@...>:
>
>> Dear all,
>>
>> It seems that for evey case, a new instance is constructed.
>>
>> If this is by design, then no need for '@Before', because the before
>> fixure code can be put in the constructor.
>
> A @Before method is guaranteed to run *just* before the test is run. The
> constructor isn't, as far as I know.

The set of documented guarantees got much tighter in JUnit 4.5:

http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc_40/org/junit/runners/BlockJUnit4ClassRunner.html#methodBlock(org.junit.runners.model.FrameworkMethod)

Share and Enjoy,

David Saff
